publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4714 Dr Elaine Murray: Pardon for Executed Soldiers—That the Parliament welcomes the statement by the UK Secretary of State for Defence, Des Browne MP, that he intends to seek posthumous pardons for the 307 soldiers court martialled and executed for cowardice, desertion and other offences during the 1914-18 war; regrets that after 90 years few of the immediate relatives of the men executed are able to appreciate the restoration of the names and reputations of these soldiers, and trusts that colleagues in the UK Parliament will approve granting a group pardon to these victims of war. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*

S2M-4714 Pardon for Executed Soldiers (lodged on 16 August 2006) Robin Harper*, Mark Ballard*, Christine Grahame*, Margaret Jamieson*, Shiona Baird*, Phil Gallie*, Fiona Hyslop*, Patrick Harvie*, Jackie Baillie*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mike Pringle*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Kate Maclean*, Alex Neil*, John Swinburne*, Des McNulty*, Karen Gillon*, Eleanor Scott*, Dennis Canavan*, Trish Godman*
S2M-4714 Pardon for Executed Soldiers (lodged on 16 August 2006) Tommy Sheridan*, Mike Rumbles*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-4714 Pardon for Executed Soldiers (lodged on 16 August 2006) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-4714 Pardon for Executed Soldiers (lodged on 16 August 2006) Mr Jim Wallace*, Cathy Peattie*

S2M-4714 Dr Elaine Murray: Pardon for Executed Soldiers—That the Parliament welcomes the statement by the UK Secretary of State for Defence, Des Browne MP, that he intends to seek posthumous pardons for the 307 soldiers court martialled and executed for cowardice, desertion and other offences during the 1914-18 war; regrets that after 90 years few of the immediate relatives of the men executed are able to appreciate the restoration of the names and reputations of these soldiers, and trusts that colleagues in the UK Parliament will approve granting a group pardon to these victims of war. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Robin Harper, Mark Ballard, Christine Grahame, Margaret Jamieson, Shiona Baird, Phil Gallie, Fiona Hyslop, Patrick Harvie, Jackie Baillie, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mike Pringle, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Kate Maclean, Alex Neil, John Swinburne, Des McNulty, Karen Gillon, Eleanor Scott, Dennis Canavan, Trish Godman, Tommy Sheridan, Mike Rumbles, Carolyn Leckie, Linda Fabiani, Mr Jim Wallace, Cathy Peattie
S2M-4714 Pardon for Executed Soldiers (lodged on 16 August 2006) Marilyn Livingstone* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
